title: best magazines for students in graphic design
content: i knw the Eye magazine and Creative Review and Graphix magazines. which other ones do you think are highly recommended for students in graphic design. thanks.
author: missgiggles

comments.content:
[STEPInside Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417094959/http:/www.stepinsidedesign.com/)

If you can find old issues of Critique magazine, I always thought the writing was very good.

[Graphis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417094959/http:/www.graphis.com/journals/index.php) isn't what it used to be, but still worth a poke through at the bookstore.

You should also consider the online forums/blogs that are populated and written by well-published authors. Specifically I'm thinking about [Design Observer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417094959/http:/www.designobserver.com/) and [Speak Up](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417094959/http:/www.underconsideration.com/speakup/).
Also, [John Benjamins Publishing Company](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417094959/http:/www.benjamins.nl/cgi-bin/welcome.cgi) has very well written journals that would apply.

Eye is probably still the best thing out there in the way of a general survey of graphic design in my opinion. It's a pity that it costs so much, but that's one of the results of not flooding the inside with advertising.

Baseline is excellent for typography:  
 [http://www.baselinemagazine.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417094959/http:/www.baselinemagazine.com/ "http://www.baselinemagazine.com/")
